verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father : but a foolish son \add is\add* the heaviness of his mother. \p
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish : but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.\f + \fr 10.3 \ft the substance…: or, the wicked for their wickedness\f*
He becometh poor that dealeth \add with\add* a slack hand : but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
He that gathereth in summer \add is\add* a wise son : \add but\add* he that sleepeth in harvest \add is\add* a son that causeth shame.
Blessings \add are\add* upon the head of the just : but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
The memory of the just \add is\add* blessed : but the name of the wicked shall rot.
The wise in heart will receive commandments : but a prating fool shall fall.\f + \fr 10.8 \ft a prating…: Heb. a fool of lips\f*\f + \fr 10.8 \ft fall: Heb. be beaten\f*
He that walketh uprightly walketh surely : but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow : but a prating fool shall fall.\f + \fr 10.10 \ft fall: Heb. be beaten\f*
The mouth of a righteous \add man is\add* a well of life : but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Hatred stirreth up strifes : but love covereth all sins.
In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found : but a rod \add is\add* for the back of him that is void of understanding.\f + \fr 10.13 \ft of understanding: Heb. of heart\f*
Wise \add men\add* lay up knowledge : but the mouth of the foolish \add is\add* near destruction.
The rich man’s wealth \add is\add* his strong city : the destruction of the poor \add is\add* their poverty.
The labour of the righteous \add tendeth\add* to life : the fruit of the wicked to sin.
He \add is in\add* the way of life that keepeth instruction : but he that refuseth reproof erreth.\f + \fr 10.17 \ft erreth: or, causeth to err\f*
He that hideth hatred \add with\add* lying lips , and he that uttereth a slander , \add is\add* a fool.
In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin : but he that refraineth his lips \add is\add* wise. \p
The tongue of the just \add is as\add* choice silver : the heart of the wicked \add is\add* little worth.
The lips of the righteous feed many : but fools die for want of wisdom.\f + \fr 10.21 \ft of wisdom: Heb. of heart\f*
The blessing of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, it maketh rich , and he addeth no sorrow with it.
\add It is\add* as sport to a fool to do mischief : but a man of understanding hath wisdom. \p
The fear of the wicked , it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
As the whirlwind passeth , so \add is\add* the wicked no \add more:\add* but the righteous \add is\add* an everlasting foundation.
As vinegar to the teeth , and as smoke to the eyes , so \add is\add* the sluggard to them that send him. \p
The fear of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* prolongeth days : but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.\f + \fr 10.27 \ft prolongeth: Heb. addeth\f*
The hope of the righteous \add shall be\add* gladness : but the expectation of the wicked shall perish. \p
The way of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* strength to the upright : but destruction \add shall be\add* to the workers of iniquity.
The righteous shall never be removed : but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth. \p
The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom : but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable : but the mouth of the wicked \add speaketh\add* frowardness.\f + \fr 10.32 \ft frowardness: Heb. frowardnesses\f*
